#include<stdio.h>
#include<string.h>
#include<iostream>

using namespace std;

void swap(char & a, char & b)
{
	char t = a; a = b ; b = t; 
}

int main()
{
 int t,n,m,c,i,j;
 char imd;
 
 scanf("%d",&t);
 while(t--)
 {
  scanf("%d%d",&n,&m);
  char mat[n][m+1];
  for(i=0;i<n;i++)
    {
     while ((c = getchar()) != '\n' && c != EOF);
     scanf("%s",mat[i]);
       for(j=0;j<m/2;j++)
     {
     //	cout <<"BEFORE SWAPPING :" << mat[i][j] << " " << mat[i][m-j-1] << endl;
     	swap(mat[i][j],mat[i][m-j-1]);
      // Better to have m-j-1 rather than changing m..looks cleaner .. Bhavya
    //	cout <<"AFTER SWAPPING :" << mat[i][j] << " " << mat[i][m-j-1] << endl;
     }
    }
    
    
  for(i=0;i<n;i++)
  {
       printf("%s\n",mat[i]);
  }
 }
 

return 0;
}
